text:
Question 179) To ensure the safety of a large public event that will start at 4 am, an organizer needs to monitor the number of people present at each moment. For every 2,000 people the presence of a police officer is necessary. In addition, it is estimated a density of four people per square meter of occupied terrain area. At 10 am, the organizer finds that the already occupied land area is equivalent to a square with sides measuring 500 m. However, in the following hours, the public is expected to increase at a rate of 120 000 people per hour until the event began, when public entry will no longer be allowed.
How many police will be needed at the beginning of the event to ensure security?
A) 360
B) 485
C) 560
D) 740
E) 860
